abstract.p: Second round results of Samsung Open tennis tournament (S)

block.p: SAMSUNG OPEN Mantilla Reaches The Quarterfinals
The defending champion and No. 3 seed Felix Mantilla defeated his fellow Spaniard, Jordi Burillo, 7-5, 6-2, to reach the quarterfinals of the Samsung Open yesterday in Bournemouth, England.
SAMSUNG OPEN Mantilla Reaches The Quarterfinals
The defending champion and No. 3 seed Felix Mantilla defeated his fellow Spaniard, Jordi Burillo, 7-5, 6-2, to reach the quarterfinals of the Samsung Open yesterday in Bournemouth, England.

In other second-round matches at the clay-court tournament, No. 2 seed Albert Costa of Spain beat Dennis Van Scheppingen of the Netherlands, 6-3, 6-2, and France's Arnaud Clement defeated Jan Kroslak of Slovakia 6-2, 7-6 (7-3).
In the other second-round match, Austria's Stefan Koubek beat Todd Larkham of Australia, 4-6, 6-0, 7-5. (AP)
Second seeded Tim Henman of Britain beat Israel's Eyal Ran, 6-4, 6-1, yesterday to advance to the quarterfinals of the President's Cup tournament in Tashkent, Uzbekistan.
In the day's major upset, unseeded Karsten Braasch of Germany overcame No. 5 seed Marc Rosset, 6-4, 6-7 (6-8), 6-3. Braasch is ranked 330th by the ATP.

In the toughest match of the second round, fourth seeded Nicolas Escude of France outplayed Sjeng Schalken of the Netherlands, 6-4, 7-6 (9-7). Schalken was ahead 5-2 when Escude broke his serve to equalize.
Italian Stefano Pescosolido, the third seed, got a battle from the Israeli Harel Levi before winning, 2-6, 7-6 (6-1), 6-3. (AP)
ROMANIAN OPEN Top-Seeded Clavet Wins as No. 2 Falls
Top-seeded Francisco Clavet advanced to the quarterfinals of the Romanian Open in Bucharest, but second seeded Richard Fromberg, the defending champion, was eliminated.
Emilio Alvarez, a Spaniard, beat Fromberg, 7-6 (7-4), 3-6, 7-5.
Clavet struggled and needed three sets to defeat the unseeded Romanian Dinu Pescariu 3-6, 7-5, 6-2. Clavet is one of the five Spaniards in the quarterfinals. (AP)
